column16: Is there a differencebetween 2.2.1 and 2.2.2 Care Plan Profile?
This profile has no constraints in the differential tab. This needs to be populated or the profile should be removed and references replaced with the unprofiled Claim resource.

Why is careManager restricted to Practitioner? Is should allow PractitionerRole so the provider organization can also be tracked. And if PractitionerRole is allowed then this is functionally the same as the unprofiled EpisodeOfCare resource, in which case this whole profile can go away.

This profile constrains US Core Goal, but the only constraint seems to be removing must-support from description, which I don't believe is a legal thing to do. This profile should be removed and all references updated to point to US Core Goal.
This profile has no constraints beyond what exists in US Core Location. This profile should be removed and all references updated to point to US Core Location.
This profile says very little beyond the base defintion of Observation. I recommend that Observation.code, Observation.code.text, and Observation.valueString  be flagged as must-support.
column17: Flag elements as MustSupport in eltss-observation

column16: This profile removes must-support from various US Core Patient elements, which I believe is not allowed.
This profile has not constraints beyond US Core Practitioner. This profile should be removed and all references updated to point to US Core Practitioenr instead.

This profile mearly reiterates a couple contraints from the base Questionaire resource. Either flag these items as must-support, or remove the profile and update with references to the unprofiled Questionnaire resource.

This profile mearly reiterates a couple contraints from the base Questionaire resource. Either flag these items as must-support, or remove the profile and update with references to the unprofiled Questionnaire resource.
Many of the contraints just reiterate what is present in the base resource. Either flag them as must-support or remove them.
